mdRecord.dcterms:title: King and Queen of the Belgians in the Upper Garden, October 29, 1919
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: National Pictorial News
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Elisabeth, Queen, consort of Albert I, King of the Belgians, 1876-1965
Albert I, King of the Belgians, 1875-1934
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photographic print of members of the royal party in the upper garden. In the foreground from left to right are: Vice President Thomas R. Marshall (back turned to camera); Queen Elisabeth, consort of Albert I; Mrs. Foster, Vice Regent for Delaware; Miss Townsend, Vice Regent for New York; and Albert I, King of the Belgians. The photographer's stamp appears on the reverse. A handwritten caption (by Harrison Dodge) reads: 'V. P. Marshall, Queen, Mrs. Foster (V.R. Del), Miss Townsend (V.R. N.Y.) and King Albert. Back & beyond the king appears Crown Prince Leopold (with "oversea" cap)'
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Upper Garden
